[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: build_locally_verified_script()] [Script verifier bypass] Do scripts use the same verifier_config as modules, or can differences in verification strictness allow scripts to bypass checks that modules must pass? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: deserialize_into_compiled_module()] [Magic number bypass] Does deserializer_config properly validate the bytecode magic number and version, or can an attacker submit bytecode from incompatible Move versions that causes undefined behavior? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: deserialize_into_compiled_module()] [Table index overflow] Can oversized table indices in serialized bytecode cause integer overflow when calculating offsets, potentially leading to out-of-bounds reads during deserialization? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: deserialize_into_script()] [Script size limit] Is there a maximum script size enforced during deserialization, or can an attacker submit extremely large scripts that cause memory exhaustion before gas metering activates? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Struct: RuntimeEnvironment] [Clone + flush race] Can concurrent clone() operations race with flush_all_caches(), causing some clones to see partially flushed state leading to non-deterministic execution? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: build_locally_verified_module()] [Concurrent verification] Can multiple threads verify the same module_hash concurrently, causing redundant verification work or race conditions in VERIFIED_MODULES_CACHE.put() operations? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Struct: RuntimeEnvironment] [Arc-wrapped cache contention] Do concurrent accesses to Arc<TypeTagCache>, Arc<StructNameIndexMap> cause lock contention that could be exploited to slow down specific validators and affect their consensus performance? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: build_verified_module_with_linking_checks()] [Module upgrade safety] When a module is upgraded (republished), does verification ensure backward compatibility with existing module state, or can upgrades break invariants of already-deployed resources? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: build_verified_module_with_linking_checks()] [Dependency upgrade race] If a dependency module is upgraded while a dependent module is being verified, can this cause the dependent to be verified against an inconsistent set of dependencies? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: flush_all_caches()] [Cache flush atomicity] Is flushing all caches atomic with respect to module loading, or can partial flush states cause some modules to reference cached data while others don't, breaking determinism? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: build_locally_verified_module()] [Pre-gas verification] Does module verification happen before gas metering, and can an attacker submit modules that cause expensive verification work without paying gas, enabling DoS attacks? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: deserialize_into_compiled_module()] [Deserialization gas] Is deserialization cost accounted for in gas metering, or can an attacker submit complex bytecode that causes expensive deserialization without adequate gas charges? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: ty_to_ty_tag()] [Type tag construction gas] Does constructing type tags for deeply nested generic types consume gas proportional to complexity, or can an attacker create expensive type tag operations without adequate gas payment? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: get_module_bytes_override()] [System module override] Can an attacker craft a transaction that targets OPTION_MODULE_ID or MEM_MODULE_ID addresses to trick get_module_bytes_override() into loading embedded modules instead of user modules, causing privilege escalation? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: natives()] [Native function exposure] Is the natives() function properly access-controlled, or can user code somehow access or enumerate registered native functions to find attack vectors? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: build_verified_module_skip_linking_checks()] [Privilege escalation via skip] Can system code paths that use build_verified_module_skip_linking_checks() be triggered by user transactions to bypass linking checks and load malicious modules? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: log_verified_cache_size()] [Side channel via metrics] Can observing VERIFIED_MODULE_CACHE_SIZE metrics over time allow an attacker to infer information about validator transaction processing patterns or private module deployments? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: build_locally_verified_module()] [Timer side channel] Does the VM_TIMER expose timing information that could be used for side-channel attacks to determine which validators are verifying which modules? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: check_natives()] [Native struct resource safety] If native structs are allowed (by bypassing check_natives()), can this violate Move's resource safety guarantees by allowing structs without proper drop semantics? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: build_verified_module_with_linking_checks()] [Resource type changes] Does linking verification ensure that resource types maintain their invariants across module upgrades, or can upgrades change resource layouts in ways that break existing on-chain resources? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: Module::new()] [Resource finalization] When Module::new() is called with natives, does it properly register resource cleanup functions, or can missing cleanup cause resource leaks violating Move's linear type system? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Struct: LocallyVerifiedModule] [Module size overflow] Can the module_size parameter overflow when cast or used in arithmetic operations, causing incorrect memory allocation sizes or bounds checking failures? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: struct_name_index_map_size()] [Size overflow] Does checked_len() properly handle the case where the actual map size exceeds usize::MAX, and what happens on 32-bit platforms if the size exceeds 4GB? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Constants: OPTION_MODULE_BYTES, MEM_MODULE_BYTES] [Format version mismatch] If the embedded .mv files are from a different Move version than the runtime, can this cause deserialization failures or undefined behavior in production? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/environment.rs] [Function: get_option_module_bytes()] [Bytes cloning overhead] Does repeatedly cloning OPTION_MODULE_BYTES cause performance issues, and can an attacker trigger excessive cloning to cause memory pressure? (Low)
